sentences.en: Early astronomers thought that our planet was the centre of the universe.
sentences.cn: 早期的天文学家认为我们的星球是宇宙的中心。

sentences.en: How many moons has the planet Jupiter?
Long long ago, we knew the periodic motion of a planet.
sentences.cn: 很久以前, 我们就知道行星的周期运动.

sentences.en: Small meteorites have left impact craters all over the planet's surface.
sentences.cn: 这个行星的表面布满了小块陨石留下的撞击坑.

sentences.en: The blue whale is the largest living thing on the planet.
sentences.cn: 蓝鲸是地球上体型最大的生物。

sentences.en: The gases that may be warming the planet will have their main effect many years hence.
sentences.cn: 可能正导致地球变暖的那些气体，其主要影响将在多年后显现。

sentences.en: The name Vulcan was given to the undiscovered planet.
sentences.cn: 一颗不为人知的行星被命名为“祝融”。

sentences.en: The new planet is about ten times the size of the earth.
sentences.cn: 新发现的行星大约是地球的10倍那么大。

sentences.en: The newly discovered world followed an orbital path unlike that of any other planet.
sentences.cn: 新发现的这个天体具有不同于任何其他行星的运行轨道。

sentences.en: The picture shows six of the nine planets in the solar system.
sentences.cn: 这张图片展示太阳系9个行星中的6个行星。

sentences.en: The planet is probably in orbit around a small star.
sentences.cn: 这颗行星可能正环绕着一颗小恒星运行。

sentences.en: The planet Jupiter may have no solid surface at all.
sentences.cn: 木星表面可能根本就不是固体的。

sentences.en: The planet Mars will be visible to the naked eye all week.
sentences.cn: 整周都可以用肉眼观察到火星。

sentences.en: The search party was teleported down to the planet's surface.
sentences.cn: 搜索队被传送到那个星球的表面。

sentences.en: The URL for the Lonely Planet travel centre is http://www.lonelyplanet.com.
sentences.cn: “孤独星球旅游中心”的网址是http：//www.lonelyplanet.com。

words.tran_cn: 星子的；星子组成的；小行星体的

phrases.tran_cn: (英， 非正式)［用以表示某人脱离了现实］你在哪颗行星上?

trans.tran_en: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.
